mixed-citation.named-content: Cryptodrassus iranicus Zamani & Chatzaki & Esyunin & Marusik 2021, sp. nov.
mixed-citation.article-title: One new genus and nineteen new species of ground spiders (Araneae: Gnaphosidae) from Iran, with other taxonomic considerations

tp:treatment-sec.p: The new species differs from the congeners by having a distinct tegular bulge ( Tb ) near the base of embolus.
The specific epithet is an adjective and refers to the collection locality of the new species.

tp:material-citation.p: IRAN • ♂ ; Kermanshah Province , Zarrin Joob Vil .; Apr. 2017 ; M. Amiri leg.; MHNG .

tp:treatment-sec.p: Habitus as in Fig. 7I . Total length 3.59. Carapace 1.57 long, 1.26 wide. Eye sizes and interdistance of PMEs: AME = 0.08, ALE = 0.09, PME = 0.11, PLE = 0.07, PME–PME = 0.03. Carapace, chelicerae, sternum, maxillae and labium light reddish brown. Chelicerae ( Fig. 7J ) with a small promarginal tooth.

Fig. 7. Cryptodrassus iranicus sp. nov. , holotype, ♂ (MHNG). A, C, H . Palp, ventral, proventral and retroventral views. B, D . Palp, retrolateral view. E–G . Bulb, ventral, proventral and retroventral views. I . Habitus, dorsal view. J . Chelicerae, posterior view. Abbreviations: Eo = embolar outgrowth; Ma = median apophysis; Tb = tegular bulge. Scale bars: A–B, E, J = 0.2 mm; D, H = 0.1 mm; I = 1 mm.

Maxillae with strong lateral protrusion. Legs the same color as carapace, with few spines and without annulations.Abdomen light brown, without any markings, with a distinct reddish brown scutum anteriorly. Spinnerets light brown and uniform in color. Measurements of legs: I: 4.78 (1.35, 0.79, 1.18, 0.85, 0.61), II: 3.94 (1.10, 0.72, 0.93, 0.70, 0.49), III: 3.16 (0.86, 0.52, 0.62, 0.69, 0.47), IV: 4.52 (1.19, 0.69, 0.98, 1.04, 0.62).

Palp as in Fig. 7A–H . Femur and patella unmodified; tibial apophysis small, sharply pointed, shorter than tibia; cymbium with rounded and short tip; bulb elongate oval; tegulum with antero-prolateral bulge ( Tb ) near base of embolus; median apophysis ( Ma ) (or conductor sensu Chatzaki et al. 2002 and Chatzaki 2018 ) subtriangular in ventral view, lacking hook; embolus relatively short, filiform, originating at ca 8 o’clock position and terminating at about 12, terminal part with short, spine-like outgrowth ( Eo ).
Known only from the type locality in Kermanshah Province , western Iran .
